page.title: 17CUSTOMS
page.content: There are very few local customs peculiar to this area alone .Like much of Somerset there is an interest in {Carnival Processions}and{Skittling which are two activities not found on the same scale elsewhere in the country.Carnival processions involve the decoration of a large trailer or lorry usually with lights ,noise and a tableau of "actors and actresses"who will depict a scene such as a battle or an activity such as a Kindergarten at play.Each of these floats is decorated and assembled by a carnival club who will spend most of the year in the planning and construction of these floats.Many villagers were found to have been involved in these activities at some time or other.The carnival procession is also an occasion to raise money for both local hospitals and charities.
